text: John Sullivan (February 17, 1740 â€“ January 23, 1795) was an American General in the Revolutionary War. He was a delegate in the Continental Congress. He was the third governor of New Hampshire. He was also a United States District judge. He led the Sullivan Expedition in 1779. In it, he attacked and destroyed many Iroquois towns. Category:American Revolutionary War Category:American generals Category:1740 births Category:1795 deaths Category:Military people from New Hampshire
title: John Sullivan (general)
